intro: Calycogonium microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved calycogonium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in warm climates for its aesthetic appeal.
